description: Removal of BT kiosk(s) and replacement with 1no. new InLink structure offering free Wi-Fi and incorporating 2no. digital 55 inc. LCD adverts.
decision_conditions: The proposed development by virtue of its size and siting would result in a visually intrusive incongruous addition to the streetscene that would compete with existing street furniture and signage creating street clutter and detract from the character and appearance of the area or preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Surbiton Town Centre Conservation Area. The proposal would not accord with section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.

The proposed development by virtue of its size and siting would result in a visually intrusive and incongruous addition to the street scene that would compete with existing street furniture and sign age creating street clutter and detract from the character and appearance of the area and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Surbiton Town Centre Conservation Area. It is considered that the proposed development would be harmful to the Conservation Area, albeit less than substantial, however, this harm is not outweighed by any public benefits. The proposal would not accord with section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012 and guidance / policy in the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition 13 (Car Park Management Plan) - The RBK Highways Engineer has reviewed the information provided and is satisfied that Condition 13 of planning permission 16/13050/FUL can now be fully approved.
Cond 3 - Officers are satified with the information provided and this can now be discharged.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Appropriate minor works with no adverse impact upon tree health or amenity.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:the only works requiring consent are those proposed to T.1 Beech as the other trees within the application are not protected and those works proposed to the other trees are therefore exempt from application.Recommendation:Consent for lesser works:T.1 Beech - 10% crown thin & deadwood.
